intro: Robiquetia vietnamensis subsp. bathra, commonly known as the Vietnamese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different floral morphology compared to the main species.
